original: At one end of the composition, the young woman's hand is depicted holding a cloth, which may suggest a maternal connection, possibly representing a mother cradling her son with a band of cloth wrapped around him. Notably, this same cloth appears in one of the drawings from the "Études pour l'Enfant Jésus," located in the Gallerie dell'Accademia in Venice. This series of studies dates back to 1503, predating the "Study for the Virgin's R
